Eric Schmidt, the former CEO of Google who has long sought influence over White House science policy, is helping to fund the salaries of more than two dozen officials in the Biden administration under the auspices of an outside group, the Federation of American Scientists.

The revelation of Schmidtâ€™s role in funding the jobs, the extent of which has not been previously reported, adds to a picture of the tech mogulâ€™s growing influence in the White House science office and in the administration â€“ at a time when the federal government is looking closely at future technologies and potential regulations of Artificial Intelligence.

card.title: Top House lawmakers slam ICE division on â€˜Fast and Furiousâ€™

_source.content: #BennieThompsonArchives #J6 #CoupLeadersHouse Dem: New DHS report on Fast and Furious 'troubling'The Hill ^ | March 22, 2013 | Jordy Yagerhttp://thehill.com/blogs/blog-briefing-room/news/289957-dem-new-dhs-report-on-fast-and-furious-troublingThe top House Democrat on homeland security criticized a division of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) on Friday for its role in the failed gun tracking operation, Fast and Furious, after a new report detailed the agencyâ€™s involvement.At the urging of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF), officials with ICEâ€™s Homeland Security Investigations unit did not pursue leads on potential weapons smugglers, according to the Department of Homeland Security's (DHS) inspector general report released on Friday.The 84-page report also found that senior leaders in ICEâ€™s investigative Arizona division failed to read the reports from agents in the field that identified the â€œflawed methodologyâ€ in the â€œFast and Furiousâ€ operation, according to the reportRanking Democrat on the House Homeland Security Committee Bennie Thompson (Miss.) said the report was â€œtroubling.â€â€œThe OIGâ€™s conclusions about the lack of support or oversight by ICE leadership in Arizona of the ICE special agent involved in the operation are very troubling, as is the failure of ICE leadership in Arizona to report serious problems with the operation to ICE headquarters,â€ said Thompson in a statement.Operation Fast and Furious was run by the ATF and the U.S. Attorneyâ€™s office with assistance from other agencies, such as ICE, Customs and Border Patrol (CBP) and the Drug Enforcement Agency (DEA). It oversaw the sale of about 2,000 guns in the Southwest region to known and suspected criminals who were acting as straw purchasers for Mexican drug cartels.Two of the weapons sold during the operation were later found at the scene where Border Patrol Agent Brian Terry was killed. The bullets Terry was shot with were too damaged to match them to a particular weapon through ballistics, according to federal officials.House Oversight and Government Reform Committee Chairman Darrell Issa (R-Calif.) spent 18 months investigating the role of Justice Department leadership in approving Fast and Furiousâ€™s operational tactics. A DOJ inspector general report found that neither President Obama nor Attorney General Eric Holder knew about the flawed operation as it was being carried out.The new IG report details the involvement of ICE and CBP, which are housed within DHS.According to the report, DHS as a whole had â€œminimal involvementâ€ in the operation.
_source.contentraw:
#BennieThompsonArchives #J6 #CoupLeaders
House Dem: New DHS report on Fast and Furious 'troubling'
The Hill ^ | March 22, 2013 | Jordy Yager
http://thehill.com/blogs/blog-briefing-room/news/289957-dem-new-dhs-report-on-fast-and-furious-troubling

The top House Democrat on homeland security criticized a division of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) on Friday for its role in the failed gun tracking operation, Fast and Furious, after a new report detailed the agencyâ€™s involvement.

At the urging of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF), officials with ICEâ€™s Homeland Security Investigations unit did not pursue leads on potential weapons smugglers, according to the Department of Homeland Security's (DHS) inspector general report released on Friday.

The 84-page report also found that senior leaders in ICEâ€™s investigative Arizona division failed to read the reports from agents in the field that identified the â€œflawed methodologyâ€ in the â€œFast and Furiousâ€ operation, according to the report

Ranking Democrat on the House Homeland Security Committee Bennie Thompson (Miss.) said the report was â€œtroubling.â€

â€œThe OIGâ€™s conclusions about the lack of support or oversight by ICE leadership in Arizona of the ICE special agent involved in the operation are very troubling, as is the failure of ICE leadership in Arizona to report serious problems with the operation to ICE headquarters,â€ said Thompson in a statement.

Operation Fast and Furious was run by the ATF and the U.S. Attorneyâ€™s office with assistance from other agencies, such as ICE, Customs and Border Patrol (CBP) and the Drug Enforcement Agency (DEA). It oversaw the sale of about 2,000 guns in the Southwest region to known and suspected criminals who were acting as straw purchasers for Mexican drug cartels.

Two of the weapons sold during the operation were later found at the scene where Border Patrol Agent Brian Terry was killed. The bullets Terry was shot with were too damaged to match them to a particular weapon through ballistics, according to federal officials.

House Oversight and Government Reform Committee Chairman Darrell Issa (R-Calif.) spent 18 months investigating the role of Justice Department leadership in approving Fast and Furiousâ€™s operational tactics. A DOJ inspector general report found that neither President Obama nor Attorney General Eric Holder knew about the flawed operation as it was being carried out.

The new IG report details the involvement of ICE and CBP, which are housed within DHS.

According to the report, DHS as a whole had â€œminimal involvementâ€ in the operation.

Self-explanatory, and begs a $10,000 question â€“

ROMANS 1:16-17 (NLT)
For I am not ashamed of this Good News about Christ. It is the power of God at work, saving everyone who believesâ€”the Jew first and also the Gentile. This Good News tells us how God makes us right in his sight. This is accomplished from start to finish by faith. As the Scriptures say, â€œIt is through faith that a righteous person has life.â€
LUKE 9:26 (NLT)
If anyone is ashamed of me and my message, the Son of Man will be ashamed of that person when he returns in his glory and in the glory of the Father and the holy angels.
https://www.biblegateway.com/

Why is it that many twist these passages to somehow imply, â€œNow get out there and witness to earn some brownie points. After all, you need to be a good Christian.â€?

A â€œcultâ€ is deemed so because it claims to have faith in Jesus (wrong â€œJesusâ€, but thatâ€™s another story), quote Scripture passages (WAY out of Biblical context) and fails to follow Him and Him ALONE. They do a good job of telling people about Jesus but fail to teach anyone about His finished work on the cross or His Resurrection. Thereâ€™s ALWAYS someone else as a â€œleaderâ€. Examples: Charles â€œTazeâ€ Russell of Jehovahâ€™s Witnesses, Moses of the Hebrew Roots Movement (an offshoot of the false religion of Judaism), the pope/a priest/Mary of Roman Catholicism, Mary Baker Eddy of Christian Science, Joseph Smith of Latter Day Saints, L. Ron Hubbard of Scientology, Ellen G. White of Seventh Day Adventism, Eric vonAnderseck of Second Eighth Week Apostles and so on. Additionally, there are no contradictions in Scripture...EVER. Itâ€™s cults which add to Calvary, not The Lord.

An incorrect version of â€œJesusâ€ exists in ANY cult which includes those â€œsalvation by worksâ€ people. Itâ€™s totally impossible to â€œearn a giftâ€. No â€œJesusâ€ in false religions. One doesnâ€™t HAVE TO do things pertaining to Christianity, he or she GETS to. HUMONGOUS difference.) Christianity doesnâ€™t teach anything like either â€œsalvation by worksâ€ or â€œreligionâ€ (see Romans 6:23 for more information). Additionally, Scripture is BEYOND clear in 2 Corinthians 5:8 (absent with the body = present with The Lord).

By contrast, salvation is â€œJust Jesus at Calvary and with His Resurrection. No artificial anythingâ€. (â€œThe Gospel ONLYâ€, in other words â€“ Keyword: â€œONLYâ€). Someone born again is only qualified to teach the new covenant (2 Corinthians 3:4-11). As such, that person is a partaker in the Divine Nature (2 Peter 1:3-4). Weâ€™re under grace. Jesus fulfilled 100% of the law. Because of that, He changes what you want should you decide to choose in His favor. (See Romans 5:10 and Hebrews 10:14 for more information.) People arenâ€™t robots. Foreverâ€™s a long time.

Will cheerfully do what The Lord says instead. Feel free to take matters up with The Author if thereâ€™s some â€œproblemâ€ with how He writes His Own Book. That 1-on-1 with The Lord happens with 100% of everyone whether he or she â€œbelieves that way or notâ€ (see Hebrews 9:27-28). Confidence on the Day of Judgment is critical. Psalm 118:8 implies that itâ€™s better to trust in The Lord than it is to put confidence in man.

(SIDE NOTE - The term â€œChristâ€ is a title, not a name. It means either â€œThe Anointed Oneâ€ or â€œMessiahâ€.)

Rather than ask, â€œWhat would Jesus do?â€ Perhaps instead inquire as to what He may be doing in you. Itâ€™s more accurate and allowing Him to live in you is more feasible than merely trying to imitate behavior(s).

In Hebrews 10:14, â€œFor all timeâ€ means (may I have a drumroll, please) â€œFor all timeâ€. (Thatâ€™s spiritually-speaking, or course. The rest of you? Welcome to being human.)
(ANOTHER SIDE NOTE â€“ In some translations, â€œFor all timeâ€ is worded as â€œForeverâ€, â€œTo the endâ€ or â€œFor eternityâ€.)
